Returns: the GoogleMap. Null if the view of the fragment is not yet ready. This can happen if the fragment lifecyle have not gone through @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#onCreateView_E@ yet. This can also happen if Google Play services is not available. If Google Play services becomes available afterwards and the fragment have gone through @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#onCreateView_E@, calling this method again will initialize and return the GoogleMap.
getMap().Description: Gets the underlying GoogleMap that is tied to the view wrapped by this fragment.

newInstance().Description: Creates a map fragment, using default options.

MapFragment().Description: Creates a map fragment. This constructor is public only for use by an inflater. Use @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#newInstance_E@ to create a MapFragment programmatically.

newInstance(com.google.android.gms.maps..Description: Creates a map fragment with the given options.

Parameters: The callback object that will be triggered when the map is ready to be used.
getMapAsync(com.google.android.gms.maps..Description: Sets a callback object which will be triggered when the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ instance is ready to be used. Note that: This method must be called from the main thread. The callback will be executed in the main thread. In the case where Google Play services is not installed on the user's device, the callback will not be triggered until the user installs it. In the rare case where the GoogleMap is destroyed immediately after creation, the callback is not triggered. The @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ object provided by the callback is non-null.

ClassDesc: A Map component in an app. This fragment is the simplest way to place a map in an application. It's a wrapper around a view of a map to automatically handle the necessary life cycle needs. Being a fragment, this component can be added to an activity's layout file simply with the XML below. @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ must be acquired using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#getMapAsync_E@. This class automatically initializes the maps system and the view. A view can be removed when the MapFragment's @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#onDestroyView_E@ method is called and the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMapOptions#useViewLifecycleInFragment_E@ option is set. When this happens the MapFragment is no longer valid until the view is recreated again later when MapFragment's @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment#onCreateView_E@ method is called. Any objects obtained from the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ is associated with the view. It's important to not hold on to objects (e.g. @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#Marker_E@) beyond the view's life. Otherwise it will cause a memory leak as the view cannot be released. Use this class only if you are targeting API 12 and above. Otherwise, use SupportMapFragment. For more information, read the
